body_html:
One workaround I did was to navigate to the directory of tensorboard.py and edit the import statement.

if name == 'main':
import sys
#import tensorflow.tensorboard.tensorboard
import tensorboard.main
#sys.exit(tensorflow.tensorboard.tensorboard.main())
sys.exit(tensorboard.main.main())

Not sure if this is good practice though

body:
One workaround I did was to navigate to the directory of tensorboard.py and edit the import statement.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    #import tensorflow.tensorboard.tensorboard
    import tensorboard.main
    #sys.exit(tensorflow.tensorboard.tensorboard.main())
    sys.exit(tensorboard.main.main())

Not sure if this is good practice though
